Raynor and Kireth Vanos, self-proclaimed Dwemer experts, left Morrowind to look for long lost knowledge and lore within Skyrim's Dwarven ruins.

Kireth Vanos has been exploring the ruins of Mzulft, looking for a valuable piece of forgotten lore. Her brother Raynor and her plan to use their findings to get invited into either Shad Astula or the Mages Guild.
Valeric believes vampires don't have to be monsters. He wants my help to stop his father, Majorn, who plans to create an army of bloodfiends.

The Banished Cells have been overrun by Daedra. They have set free the immortal High Kinlord Rilis, an evil being of great magical power. I have agreed to help Keeper Cirion, the warden of the Banished Cells, deal with this crisis.
<<1>> offered to tell me the story of the Green Lady and show me the most sacred sites of Deepwoods.
Vicious raiders known as the Steel Shrikes attacked a troupe of traveling entertainers. They hold several performers captive at Fuller's Break.
<<1>> wants to take his own type of revenge against the Steel Shrikes who destroyed his troupe's ship and livelihood.
Jorunn the Skald-King has been poisoned. Now he lies in an eternal slumber. The Ternion monks, who revere the Three Old Gods, attempt to cure him. But time is running out.
Fildgor the usurper fled to the ancient dragonshrine of Skuldafn to steal Queen Nurnhilde's spirit and force the Crown of Freydis to recognize him. I need to stop him.
Inside the tombs of Skuldafn, I discovered that Fildgor Orcthane crossed into Sovngarde. To defeat Fildgor, I must follow him there.
Draugr have spilled from the barrow beneath Bonestrewn Crest. Now they roam the area, attacking the living.
Maormer Sea Vipers invaded Ilayas Ruins, searching for a weather-controlling relic called the Sphere of Storms. I've been asked to help the stormwardens defend the sphere until reinforcements arrive.
The Dreamwalker is lost in King Jorunn's nightmares. I must enter the Dreamstride and try to rescue both of them before the Daedric poison kills the King.
The Drublog clan of Wood Orcs captured <<c:1>>. I need to infiltrate Jathsogur and do whatever's necessary to free him.
The Orcthane's troops have taken control of the mine in Lost Knife Cave. They're forcing the miners to produce ore to equip Fildgor's army.
Foreman Jomund discovered a mysterious metal in the mine. He hastily hid their research notes and the ore sample just as the Stormfists began taking over the mine.
Maormer attacked an Aldmeri Dominion ship off the coast of <<1>> and captured several members of its crew.
Though the <<C:1>> had been destroyed, the Maormer still hold <<2>> captive at <<3>>.
<<1>> asked me to burn the Maormer sailboats in <<2>> to prevent further ambushes.
Worm Cultists have attacked <<1>>.
Someone is stirring up chaos in <<1>>, and <<2>> asked me to help put a stop to it.
The people of Riften have been brought inside their shattered walls. While Sinmur is gone, however, Riften's people may face other threats.
Though most of the rotmeth was stolen, an unfinished batch remains. <<1>> needs some special ingredients to complete what's left of the brew.
Jomund and his miners have no idea what to make of the mysterious metal they found. However, Jomund has a friend at Fort Amol who might be able to help.
The Ebonheart Pact has come together under King Jorunn's command to battle the Worm Cult at the ruins of Honrich Tower.
<<1>>, an Argonian healer, told me that many Pact soldiers lie wounded around Honrich Tower.
Magister Osanne may have sent word to the Orcthane about the mysterious ore found in Lost Knife Cave. Tridi decided to scout the area on her own for any signs of a messenger.
<<1>> needs to join her fellow spirits in Treehenge, but something prevents her.

Indaenir, the new Silvenar, traveled across Malabal Tor to marry the Green Lady and fulfill his role as the spiritual leader of the Wood Elves. But the Hound arrived first and is trying to usurp his position.

People from across the Aldmeri Dominion gather to celebrate the handfast of the Silvenar and the Green Lady. The Hound, however, caused many of them trouble. Among these are a group of minstrels led by <<1>>.
Tervur Sadri, the co-owner of the Darkshade mine, wants me to help him find his partner, Selos, and get rid of the thugs who've displaced his miners.
Survivors of the plague from Narsis have built a refugee camp inside long-abandoned crypts. <<1>> and her husband came to join the group, but became separated.
Rigurt the Brash has been named Master of Ceremonies for the celebration of King Jorunn's anniversary. Rigurt has many organizational duties to attend to and needs a little help.

Something is definitely happening at Fort Amol. Groups of high-ranking Nords, Argonians, and Dark Elves are on hand, and the guards are turning travelers away from the inn. I should try to figure out what's going on.
<<1>> does not believe <<2>>'s story about <<3>> becoming infected. Something isn't right.
After events in Shadowfen, Vicecanon Heita-Meen and I must travel to Eastmarch, in Skyrim.
I've arrived in Nimalten to find the city under threat. Thane Fjora was attacked by her housecarl. Aera Earth-Turner, my old friend from Bleakrock Isle, is leading an investigation.
The Worm Cult ambushed and captured several Wood Elves in <<1>>. The Cult may be preparing for a dark ritual.
Someone's soul is trapped in an Ayleid tomb within Abamath. A puzzle lock prevents her from escaping.
Stormfist spies have used Daedric alchemy to infiltrate Fort Amol. The King and the Pact delegates are in danger. I need to convince someone that the threat is real before it's too late.
I've received a chilly welcome at Fullhelm Fort. The garrison is beset by undead, and the old Thane is not welcoming strangers.
A spinner in Valeguard wants to finally transcribe a story into written word, but is having difficulties.
<<1>>, an agent of Shadowfen's leadership, asked me to help <<2>> investigate a number of murders in Stormhold.
Even though we've won a victory over the Worm Cult, <<1>> tells me that <<2>> is headed toward Riften. I should follow in the wake of the giant.
<<1>> must take root in Treehenge before the Worm Cult can corrupt her soul.
Thane Harvald want Lord Vurlop and I to go into the keep and check on King Jorunn. We need to make sure that the King and his war council are safe.
A merchant in Nimalten claims his silk was stolen by bandits. I've been asked to retrieve it for the angry businessman.
Stormy-Eyes seems to be recovering from the Dreamstride experience. King Jorunn and Prince Irnskar have gone ahead to Jorunn's Stand, a large encampment near Skuldafn.
Skald Svari has been proposed as the next Sage of Fallowstone Hall. She must pray at Fallowstone's shrines to ask the approval of the Companion spirits. I've been asked to accompany her.
Preparations were completed just in time - the undead are attacking Fullhelm Fort! <<1>> has asked me to help defeat the attack.
Tovisa wants help at Northwind Mine. The Reachmen have taken over the mine and we need to find out why.
There's a coven of Hagravens in Northwind Mine. They need to die.
Lieutenant Koruni asked me to deliver a dispatch detailing Fort Morvunskar's status to Thane Oda Wolf-Sister at Fort Amol.
<<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>> are missing and likely in trouble. Snorrvild has asked me to help find them.
The spirit Valdur worries about his fellow companion spirit, bound to Pinepeak Cavern. He's asked me to check on her.
Valdur spoke of a dark gathering at Honrich Tower.
The Worm Cult has barred the route to <<1>>. King Jorunn has asked me to clear the way.
We're almost there. We must fight through Worm Cultists to reach Sinmur and defeat him!
Ebonheart Pact soldiers carry amulets into battle, so they can be identified if they die. Collecting these amulets may bring solace to the families of the dead.

Redguard invaders attacked Velyn Harbor, while Drublog Wood Orcs entered the town from the hills. With the harbor's defenders either killed or scattered in the attack, only a few Fists of Thalmor continue the defense.
The battle for Velyn Harbor continues. With a little luck and a lot of effort, the Redguard invaders and Drublog Wood Orcs can be driven from the town.
<<1>> isn't a resident of Velyn Harbor, but he's been caught up in their problems.
<<1>> hired Gold Coast mercenaries from Colovia to protect his tradepost, but suspects they will turn on him.
A runner arrived from Fort Morvunskar, an installation to the west. Thane Mera believes Fildgor's forces have launched an attack against the fort.
<<1>> wants to neutralize the Gold Coast mercenaries in Malabal Tor so his people will be safe from reprisal.
I've discovered a Worm Cult cell has come to the ruins of a Dragon Cult stronghold. No good can come of this.
Thane Oda Wolf-Sister believes that the Ternion monks might be able to heal King Jorunn. But their complex rituals require special components.
Dralof Waterwalker and his friends bathe in the hot springs south of Wittestadr. Their friend, Grida, went off to gather bath salts for the water, but she never returned.
Trolls overran the town of Darkwater Crossing and now the Argonians who lived there have taken refuge in a nearby cave.
Inside a broken tower, I found a wounded woman named Imwyn Frost-Tree. She told me of a powerful symbol of her faith, the Sigil of Nature's Accord.
The town of Silsailen is under attack by imposters disguised as First Auridon Marines. The townspeople suspect these men and women are a part of a group called the Veiled Heritance.
Teldur has kidnapped Canonreeve Valano and taken him into the manor.
While in Silsailen, I learned that the imposters have taken real Auridon Marines captive.
Queen Ayrenn asked me to join her at the ancient site Tanzelwil where she must commune with the dead. She's worried there may be … complications.
I wandered into a strange rift between the living world and the land of the dead. Here, I met the spirit of Sonya Lastblood, who said that her husband killed her and her three daughters.
Queen Ayrenn seeks to perform rituals honoring her ancestors. When she arrived at Tanzelwil, however, she found the spirits angered and violent.

The Argonian Steady-Hand believes he's the best hunter in Eastmarch, better than any Nord or Dark Elf alive. He's challenged me to a hunting contest. If I can shoot a number of rabbits in one minute, or catch the rabbit called Golden Jack, I win.

Maormer pirates took the lighthouse at South Beacon and are signalling more pirate ships to come into port. If they're not stopped, they'll have the numbers they need to move on the port of Vulkhel Guard.
I discovered a Mages Guild expedition at the ruins of Ezduiin. A scholar named Telenger is in charge.
In the ruins of Ezduiin, I found an enterprising researcher working with Telenger. She's concerned about the recent appearance of the spirits. She seeks a way to lay them to rest.
Queen Ayrenn must perform the final ritual at Tanzelwil in the ancestral crypts. Malicious spirits plague this holy shrine and the traitorous Norion lurks somewhere in the shadows.
Strange stones emanating necromantic energy have appeared on the sacred grounds of Tanzelwil. Priestess Langwe believes they might be tied to the disturbed demeanor of the Ancestral Spirits.
Two Weynon villagers were taken by the vampires of <<1>>. <<2>> fears they are dead and about to rise as bloodfiends.
I've put a stop to the threat of the Reachmen, but the threat to the Rift is far from over. The Worm Cult is massing in force, and the settlements west of Nimalten need to be warned.
<<1>> asked me to travel to <<2>> and take revenge on the Black Dagger bandits for the deaths of her friends.
The Claw of Akatosh has been stolen from Weynon Priory by the Black Dagger gang. I've been asked to recover it.
An Altmer doing research in Treehenge found some cultists poaching mammoths at the shrine.
<<1>> has been trapped in Sanguine's celebration for four years. He's convinced he can only escape if the other party goers are distracted by an entertainment troupe from Morrowind.
<<1>> asked me to find his friend <<2>>, who was carrying supplies for Weynon Priory.
A Shadowed Path necromancer has transformed into a lich in <<1>>.
The Black Daggers are using an abandoned house west of Weynon to store supplies.
<<1>> has asked me to travel to <<2>> and return <<3>> to rest.
Geirmund's Hall hosts a festival, and Thane Vofknir is looking for brave souls willing to participate in an epic challenge. Those who pass the tests are named Geirmund's Guardian.
The warrior Daljari Half-Troll oversees the Trial of the Body, a test of brawn over brain.
Iroda, a member of the Thane's household, proctors the Trial of the Mind. She's going to pose riddles to me. I need to seek out the answers to each on the island, then return to her.

Widulf, a priest of Kyne, proctors the Trial of Spirit. It apparently involves drinking a somewhat poisonous mead and then running around the island. Widulf assures me the poison will connect me with my inner spirit.
A bunch of dumb, drunken bards have gotten themselves stuck in a giant camp near Ivarstead. They tried to charm the giants with music. Now I need to run over there and save them.
I met a Nord named Eirfa at Geirmund's Hall. She asked if I'd be interested in participating in a drinking contest. Let's see how this goes.
Necromancer Gullveig has captives imprisoned at the Worm Cult camp. I should try to rescue them.
I arrived in the city of Vulkhel Guard, gateway to Auridon. Security is tight as Queen Ayrenn, the new leader of the Aldmeri Dominion, prepares to make a public appearance.

At the request of the captain of the Vulkhel Watch, I've been running errands all over Auridon's port city. I even helped deal with a criminal named Fasion who claimed that Captain Astanya is working with a group called the Veiled Heritance.
Captain Erronfaire is desperate to leave port, but she's lost track of some of her crew. She needs them found so she can set sail for Velyn Harbor.
Spies from the Aldmeri Dominion have infiltrated Sanguine's celebration. <<1>> gave me Sanguine's goblet and wants me to find the spies.

Firsthold is under assault by High Kinlady Estre. The First Auridon Marines have arrived to try and save the city, but the city is overrun with Daedra and the castle proper is surrounded by a magical barrier.
In order to save Firsthold and all of Auridon from High Kinlady Estre, the Oblivion portals must be closed and Estre defeated for good.
<<1>> asked that I eliminate four flame atronachs issuing from the lava fissure in Chorrol.
The town of Phaer is beset by a mysterious plague. The town alchemist, Hendil, has taken steps to treat the ill.
Lliae asked me to trigger a Black Dagger ambush north of Chorrol.
Velatosse is suspicious about the plague's origins. She's asked me to look into the source of this mysterious illness.
The Rothalens have fallen on hard times. Sarisa has designs on Bar-Neeus's stall in the central market.
Lliae asked me to bring supplies to one of her caches out in Cyrodiil.
I found a lost member of the Queen's entourage near the entrance to a hidden Vale. She told me that her fellow entourage members have been taken. A mad mage apparently holds them in the Vale.
<<1>> is encamped at Trolhetta with the bulk of the Ebonheart Pact's army. The Worm Cult is dug in, and hoping to hold on until they can gather the shards of Wuuthrad for some nefarious purpose.
I need to test out a quest where someone reads two books. Fortunately, Jacques know where I can find them. He's lost, but he knows where to find books.
This is the Background Journal Text
I discovered a statue outside the small town of Shattered Grove. The statue is remarkably lifelike and warm to the touch.
<<1>> senses that a powerful Daedra has wrested control of the animals. As long as the Daedra remains, Merormo won't free the villagers.
Svein fears that the fate of the dead in <<1>> will never be known to their families in Riften.

Drublog Orcs attacked the village of Tanglehaven. <<1>> said the survivors barely managed to fend them off. After the massacre, the surviving Tanglehaven militia chased the Drublog into the forest—including <<2>>, <<1>>'s daughter.
A group of researchers were ambushed by the Worm Cult at Pinepeak Caverns.
The Worm Cult is up at the top of the dragonshrine. I'm not sure what they're doing, but it can't be good.
A blind Redguard pirate is willing to share his treasure with anyone who can transport him to Anvil, even the Wood Elves harassing him.
Frostmoon Farmstead has been attacked, resulting in several grisly murders. Guard Jorald needs help uncovering the killer or killers.
Falinesti Summer Site is a legendary seasonal location for the Wood Elves' Walking City. But the city hasn't been seen in Tamriel for centuries. Now, something is happening at the Summer Site.
The Worm Cult is performing a ritual at an altar somewhere in the Smokefrost Peaks.
I'm working with Razum-dar, at the town of Mathiisen. He's looking into reports of the Veiled Heritance in the area for Queen Ayrenn.
I uncovered evidence linking important community members in Mathiisen to the Veiled Heritance. Now Raz has asked me to take the fight to them directly.

A Covenant officer and her husband attempted to defect to the Aldmeri Dominion. Covenant troops pursued the Orc couple all the way to Auridon, and they've taken North Beacon in an attempt to capture the Orcs.

I died, but that was only the beginning …. I awoke in Oblivion. My body is intact, but my soul has been torn from my body. I must find a way out of this nightmare place to reclaim what was lost to me, or I will be damned for all eternity.
Torinaan is a holy site dedicated to the Divines. It's been corrupted by Daedra. The loyal clergy there want my aid in cleansing the area.
Torinaan's strange little relic-keeper worries the holy relics will be corrupted by Daedric energies.
The Worm Cult is raising dead giants to fight Pact soldiers.
The Spider Cult has come to Fungal Grotto. Members of the Fighters Guild, led by Defender Two-Blades, are determined to stop the Cult from raising an army of shadows that will destabilize the region.
Sage Svari has asked me to recover <<1>> from bandits at Fort Greenwall.
Sage Svari has asked me to find and return <<1>>. She believes it's being held at Faldar's Tooth.
I met Arfanel, a member of the Eyes of the Queen at North Beacon. He's tracking an elite Covenant soldier and wants my assistance supporting the troops in the field.
There's a Worm Cult ritual going on in the Ragged Hills. Amitra needs my help in stopping it.

Three friends have drunkenly wandered into the catacombs beneath Windhelm after having a good time at the Konunleikar. They won't leave the catacombs until they're reunited, but it's not safe for them to search the tunnels alone.
I found a note on the charred corpse of an assassin who was sent to kill a mage named Malsia. She stole Dwarven artifacts and plans to open a portal to someplace. The Mages Guild wants her dead.
Nilwen is living in a shack outside Ivarstead. She tells of fierce beasts nearby and needs someone to slay them.
The farmer <<1>> requested my help in dealing with a glowfly infestation in his hay at Ivarstead.
In the Hall of the Dead beneath Windhelm I met <<1>>. She plans to gain favor in King Jorunn's court by eliminating <<2>>, an ancient necromancer entombed in the Merethic Era.
I met a mer named <<1>> near the ruin known as Quendeluun. He claims the Veiled Heritance took his daughter. He tracked them to the site.
I met an Argonian named <<1>> in the ruins of Quendeluun. She's asked me to help me secure her freedom.

I arrived at a place called the College of Aldmeri Propriety. One of the students claims this Thalmor training ground heaps hardship and abuse upon the Wood Elf and Khajiit students. She's asked me to investigate.
I arrived in Skywatch to find a festival in honor of the High Kinlady Estre in full swing.
I've been taken to the secret island stronghold of the Veiled Heritance. If I can pass their trials, I may be able to discover the true leader behind the Veil.

Three Pact soldiers were kidnapped in the Lion's Den: Hilka, Hald, and Fjar. Their commander, Thragof, is certain one of them is a traitor. He has tasked me with identifying the traitor and freeing the others.

<<1>>, a member of a Pact scouting party, barely escaped capture after discovering a hidden Lion Guard base in the mountains of the Rift. She needs a distraction to buy some time, so she can return with reinforcements.

A tribe of Wood Orcs is protecting Canonreeve Oraneth in <<1>> . <<2>>, a member of the Mages Guild, wants to stop them, but can't attack the Orcs directly due to their association with <<3>>, who is a member of the Thalmor.
A Khajiiti merchant calling himself <<1>> claims to have found a way inside Belarata, a long-sealed Ayleid ruin.

The Maormer struck <<1>>, and now lay waste to the town. Auridon troops tried and failed to retake the area, and now await reinforcements before trying again. I've been tasked with reactivating an ancient Aldmeri device on the nearby cliffs.

A research team from <<1>> has rediscovered the ancient city of Root Sunder. Unfortunately they've also been mauled by wild animals. <<2>>, the last survivor of the research team, needs the journals of her dead comrades.

Tamien, an ex-Red Rook bandit, claims he wants to save the town of Eagle's Brook. The Lion Guard, however, don't trust him. Tamien says the Bloodthorns are turning townfolk into zombies. He wants my help to prepare a spell to protect the villagers.
I cast Merien's White Mask, a spell to hide the villagers from the Bloodthorn invaders. Now Merien wants my help to stop the Bloodthorn activity in Eagle's Brook.
The Sea Drakes have captured friends of <<1>>. They're being held at <<2>>.
I'm now a full member of the Veiled Heritance. I've been told of a grand hall where their leadership council meets. And they are meeting with the Veiled Queen herself!
I must discover what has happened to the missing nobles of Direfrost Keep.
I came across a dead body on the path to the Everfull Flagon. The dead body clutches a note.
The pirate captain One-Eye and her crew reached Coldharbour through a whirlpool while searching for a legend called the Lost Fleet. They seem intent on investigating the nearby wrecks.
Grand Warlord Sorcalin has authorized a bonus for any Dominion soldier who slays 20 enemy combatants.
I discovered the Library of Dusk, an Ayleid ruin, just beyond the Hollow City. Several treasure-hunters and scholars in the service of the Mages Guild have been trapped within the ruins by Daedra.
The Mages Guild hired dungeon-delvers and scholars to bolster their expedition force. A group of these treasure hunters are trapped in the Library of Dusk, including Kireth Vanos' brother, Raynor.

I discovered the Cliffs of Failure, where Molag Bal's failed servants compete to get back into his good graces. Lost members of the Mages Guild have been ensnared in this twisted game, and I need to join in to save them.
The town of Dawnbreak has been overrun by Daedra. In response, First Auridon Marines have arrived to aid the town.
After aiding the people of Dawnbreak, Landare asked me to move down the road to Firsthold. If Dawnbreak faced the Daedra, chances are the city of Firsthold has as well.
Captain One-Eye was forced to kill her own crew, and now she's vowed to destroy the apparition that controlled the cursed sailors.
Elanwe's son, Sorondil, is the illegitimate son of the deceased High Kinsman Rilis XII. Sorondil has come to these ruins to retrieve a great treasure and his inheritance.
A restless spirit of Castle Rilis named Lisondor has asked me to retrieve his soul from a mad jester's playroom.
To save the Mages Guild members that were forced to compete in the Observer's game, I decided to side with Angof. Now I just need to find a way to win the game.
I revealed High Kinlady Estre is the Veiled Queen. Queen Ayrenn wants me to make sure Dawnbreak is safe for her to continue her campaign.
Battlereeve Urcelmo has asked that I meet with Razum-dar near the town of Mathiisen. Raz is apparently investigating more threads in the Veiled Heritance plot.
I have purged the Veiled Heritance from Mathiisen. Now I should meet up with Razum-dar in Skywatch to learn what other plans the Veiled Heritance has.
To save the members of the Mages Guild that were forced to compete in the Observer's game, I decided to side with Thallik. Now I just need to find a way to win the game.
To save the Mages Guild members that were forced to compete in the Observer's game, I decided to side with Kinlady Estre. Now I just need to find a way to win the game.

An ancient Argonian settlement called Haj Uxith occupies a dark corner of Coldharbour. The Argonians want to help me in my quest, but they seem to be divided over something related to their Hist tree.
<<1>> wants me to look for his friend, Marq, who seems to think he's a Goblin.
A Bosmer named Peras escaped from bandits hiding in the Crimson Cove. He claims his ship was boarded by the raiders, and he has friends still inside the cove.
I encountered a talking skull in the Lost Fleet. It seems  he can resist the power of the Crown of Bones, but was broken to bits because of this.
<<1>> is a Proctor for the Aldmeri Dominion. He has tracked a bandit group known as the Crimson Raiders to their hideout. The Raiders have been causing trouble for the Dominion fleet.
Alanwe lives a tortured existence in the Crypt of Hearts. Her soul has been shattered, and the pieces strewn throughout the Crypt. I have promised to help her.
I stumbled onto the ruins of a campsite by the beach. Sea Drakes attacked and kidnapped two people last night.
Rulorn in <<1>> has offered a bounty for Dwarven parts.
<<1>> was sent by his mother to prove his courage. He'd like me to help him.
The Mages Guild is investigating a strange Ayleid ruin, which has recently become much more active than in years past.
<<1>> uncovered information proving <<Ac:2>> is definitely located within <<Ac:3>>. She needs my help in recovering it.
I found an ancient letter in <<Ac:1>>. It speaks of an ancient, forbidden love.
I met a Breton in the middle of the swamps of Shadowfen. She seems to be lost.

<<1>>, a traveling Argonian merchant, lost her guar and a valuable ruby to crocodiles in the swamp. She's too hurt to round them up, so she asked me to search for the ruby and her favorite guar, <<2>>.
A researcher and his apprentice are experimenting with an amulet that protects the wearer from wamasu lightning.
While exploring Coldharbour, I came across the Tower of Lies. Instead of a tower, the place is actually a hole in the ground where members of the Fighters Guild have been imprisoned.
I met the Wood Orcs of <<1>> in <<2>>. They have come under attack from raiders and gradually weakened by an unknown source. I should work with <<3>> to track down the source.
<<1>>, the largest port on the Long Coast, has been taken by a powerful band of pirates!
I've helped track down the source of the poison in <<1>>, but the poisoner still remains to be found. I should work with <<2>> to bring the culprit to justice.
<<1>> has asked me to find and deal with <<2>>, the real force behind the attacks on <<3>>.
I came across an abandoned pack at the edge of a dark forest. The pack suggests that members of the Fighters Guild might have been here.
I've discovered the Ember-Eye's plans for an assault on Koeglin Lighthouse. I should bring these to Koeglin Village.
The slavers have captured the crew of a ship that crashed on the rocks. <<1>> has asked me to free them.
<<1>> and some of his inn workers were meeting a trader to restock supplies when pirates invaded <<2>>. Everyone scattered, and now his workers are lost in the marsh.
<<1>> wants my help to keep her "side business" going. She assures me it isn't technically illegal.
A researcher named <<1>> is trapped in the ruins of Root Sunder.
Ancalin, an old Altmer woman, asked me to pray at the grave markers of her four children. She hopes my travels around the island will give them some peace.
<<1>> has offered me a chance to enter the frog race. If my frog wins, we'll split the prize.
<<1>>'s pet—a Dwarven construct—has broken down. She wants me to steal parts so that she can repair it.
A list of various Veiled Heritance members was found. Egranor is ensuring the people listed are brought to justice.
Imperial archers are preventing rebel troops from crossing the river.
In the confusion of battle, Sylvian Herius left a family heirloom in the Imperial-held cathedral across the river.
Bandits called The Thorns stole all the Cheydinhal rebels' valuables when war broke out.
Vyctoria Girien asked me to taint Imperial food stores with a special spice.
<<1>> wants an Imperial lieutenant killed, to hurt their army's morale and readiness.
The Imperials have captured two of Vyctoria Girien's soldiers.
<<1>> asked me to deliver orders to a rebel spy in Imperial-held Cheydinhal.
The Shadowed Path has taken over an estate southwest of Cheydinhal. They are using Daedric stones to summon atronachs.
A researcher by the name of Neramo is exploring the Dwemer ruins of Bthzark, looking for a way inside.
<<1>> collects Ayleid items. She hasn't been able to search for any since the war started.
Sylvian Herius's troops have written petitions, asking the gods' intervention on the rebel side.
My first trial in Sheogorath's realm awaits. Valaste and Shalidor have uncovered what they need to get me where I need to go.
<<1>> led a mutiny against the captain and crew of the Albatross as they searched <<Ac:2>> for ancient treasure.
I met a strange old Wood Elf outside the ancient ruin known as Thormar. She's invited me to a party she calls "the greatest in all the worlds."
I stumbled onto an investigator named Pirondil being threatened by an unknown Altmer assailant in a Goblin cave. He's enlisted me to help get to the bottom of the situation.
<<1>> has expressed concerns about events unfolding at Alcaire Castle. She asked me to go there and see if I can help.
A polite spirit named <<1>> haunts <<Ac:2>>. He asked for my help in stopping the necromantic ritual that binds him to this place.
The traveling merchant Sigunn has asked for help retrieving supplies he lost after a giant attack.
A wanted bandit named Yngrel the Bloody has been causing trouble along the northern road in the Rift. I've been offered a reward to bring him down.
I met a Nord woman who's searching for her father in the northern hills of the Rift.
My investigations of the Bloodthorn Cult's activities have convinced Chief Tazgol that they threaten the Orcs on Betnikh.
I ran into a captive Khajiit in Toothmaul Gully. I've opted to free him and entertain his offer.
<<1>> has come to <<2>> to find out why the Drublog attacked Velyn Harbor.
I arrived in Mournhold, the capital city of the Ebonheart Pact. As the seat of Dunmer power, it is home to the Tribunal Temple. Due to recent events, the city is bustling with visitors.
A man named Jakarn was thrown into the Grave, a prison below <<1>>. Apparently the headman of the town accused him of stealing a valuable gem.
Merchants from House Hlaalu are worried about their leader, Raston Vendil. He went to negotiate a trade agreement with the isolated Mabrigash tribe in the Vale of the Ghost Snake. He never returned.
<<1>> told me his clan had a hand in the Silvenar's alleged kidnapping by the Hound.
<<1>> wants my help to prank her Subtle Knife rival, <<2>>, who has won their trickster duels for the last four years.

<<1>> believes the Wood Orc clan of Dra'bul, the Drublog, would not have attacked Velyn Harbor under normal circumstances.\n\nShe needs to take some time to visit with local leaders in Velyn Harbor before going to Dra'bul.
I used the key to search the House Dres farmhouses outside Mournhold. I found a suspicious-looking trap door hidden under a rug. Naryu thinks we'll discover a connection to the Maulborn down there.
The Mane has released Dro-m'athra spirits on Fort Grimwatch! Twins <<1>> and <<2>>, Khajiit Champions, lead the fight against the creatures.
I've worked with the Lunar Champion Shazah to seal up corruption wells inside of Fort Grimwatch. Now I've met up with her sister Khali to explore an unearthed Khajiiti temple.
The Worm Cult has invaded the ruins of Rulanyil's Fall, intent on raising an Ayleid warlord from the dead. <<1>> wants to ensure the body is not disturbed.
The Merethic Society hid several of its most valuable treasures throughout the ruins of Rulanyil's Fall.
After eating too many moon-sugar candies, <<1>>'s Khajiit husband, <<2>>, ran screaming into the forest.
I have entered the Blessed Crucible to test my strength and take the Brimstone Crown. Talres Voren has financially backed my bid to become champion with the promise of riches and rewards.
I dug up a chest by the shipwreck near Saintsport. It contained a shovel and directions written by a Captain Izad. It supposedly contains clues to a treasure buried on Stros M'Kai.
<<1>> got locked in a cage just before the Goblin invasion of Cumberland's Watch.
<<1>> has asked me to track down Rama and make him pay for his crimes.
The Prophet has contacted me across great distance for some important purpose.
While exploring along the river, I found an Argonian enveloped in lightning. I found a journal nearby his body. It contained instructions on how to help him.
Now that I've recruited at least one of the people Kaleen wanted, we can pull off her heist whenever I'm ready.
The Silvenar assures me he will recover from his imprisonment in Jathsogur and I should not wait for him. He wants me to meet him in the city of Silvenar where he will marry the Green Lady.
Laganakh senses evil spreading on Betnikh. We need to know what we're facing before we can fight it. A totem may grant me visions that will help us.
After the ritual at Rawl'kha, I traveled to meet the Lunar Champions at the temple called Moonmont. Here I'm told the Dark Mane has holed up. After what it did to Mane Akkhuz-ri, we must destroy it.
The Vinedusk Rangers are under siege by an invading Colovian force. They've offered me a chance to join the fight.
Clan Mother Shuzura has apparently been very hard on her assistants. There are problems in the little town of S'ren-ja. Perhaps I can help out.
<<1>> has been having problems with rats down his well.
Word around town is that the farmer Ezzag is having trouble in his fields.
The rumor around town is that Kalari's new house is haunted.
I helped the people of S'ren-ja with their many and varied problems.
With the Colovians removed from the village, Captain Odreth has planned a counterattack with his Rangers. We are to use a secret tunnel to gain access to the Colovian camp and take them out.
Telenger the Artificer, a renowned sage, has come to the Falinesti Autumn Site in search of answers.
I met a Bosmer named Ongalion at the Falinesti Autumn Site. He's a tree-steward, helping to tend the site while the city is away.
In the wake of a Dro-m'Athra attack, a lunar priest has asked me to save a priceless relic from the vault behind Moonmont.
A note posted at the entrance to Knife Ear Grotto by a scholar warns of danger inside.
I discovered the body of a Dark Elf in a cave. There's a note next to the body.
I found the body of a House Redoran soldier. He carried a medallion inscribed with instructions for his retainer, Lladrelo.
While exploring <<A:1>> I came across a campsite with an inscribed vase. The inscription read as if it was given to someone, but I only found skeletons in the tomb.
After our tricks at Thormar, Aniel has ushered me into Baan Dar's realm: The Five Finger Dance.
While exploring <<1>> I came across a battered Nord shield.
I've come upon an active battlefield, as Colovian forces attempt to take an Ayleid ruin from Dominion soldiers.
<<1>> and his brother, <<2>>, came to the ruins in search of a plant which grows in the light of an Ayleid well. Its sap is rumored to cure any malady.
The Bloody Hand Goblins have stolen Cropsford's seeds, needed for next season's crops.
<<1>> and his Goblins killed Gugnir's brothers and left him for dead. He asked me to avenge his brothers by killing the Goblin king.
<<1>> has asked me to collect offerings to Zenithar from several villagers around Cropsford.
A drunk named Shazeem seems to have lost his memory. He offered to sell me a trained monkey, claiming it can find buried treasure.
Produce around Cropsford is not being harvested. It's going to go bad unless something's done soon.
In a cave full of plunder, I found a dead man clutching a note to his sister. Though the bracelet accompanying the note has little monetary value, his sister may be glad to have it back.
Ufgra gra-Gum says that undead creatures infest the ruins of Culotte to the southwest of Cropsford.
Captain Kaleen's cabin girl, Nicolene, informed me that Kaleen's crew is ready to start the heist as soon as I'm done recruiting.
Fists of Thalmor were attacked by strange creatures in <<1>>. While many were slain, there may be survivors.
I found a stolen item with the name <<1>> etched on it, as well as an address.
Prefect Antias asked me to re-light the flame atop Crown Point tower.
A mortally wounded man in <<1>> asked me to take word of his death to his wife.
Bloody Hand skirmishers are lurking on the outskirts of town. Ufgra is very worried about them.
The Hedorans were killed by bandits. <<1>> has asked me to recover anything I find in the remains of their home.
The Bloodthorn Cult recently attacked Stonetooth Fortress. The Orcs repelled the attack but something was stolen.
I found the journal of a young man named Vareldur in the mine called Del's Claim. He died trying to stop the Heritance from killing the miners there.
Orc spirits have risen around Moriseli. I've been asked to investigate the source of this disturbance.
I've found a strange glowing artifact from the age of the Altmeri deep within the ruins of Bewan.
<<1>> is worried about Cropsford's books being destroyed in a Goblin attack.

A tailor tried to take a shortcut through Cambray Pass and was attacked by a pack of wild wolves. He lost the tools of his trade as he fled. He asked me to retrieve his possessions and meet him at the northern end of the pass.
A note in Ilessan Tower has informed me that the Red Rooks are amassing resources for their allies. It also mentioned an attack on a manor north of Deleyn's Mill.
I agreed to help <<1>> kill a Goblin that <<2>> has been feeding.
I found a journal within the Mines of Khuras. It contained a message addressed to Odette Vinielle.
Deep inside a dungeon called Mehrunes' Spite, I found a Scamp with a labeled choker. It apparently belongs to a mage in Skywatch.

I found a message within Cryptwatch Fort indicating that the Red Rooks are worried the Bloodthorn cult will turn against them. The note also contains recipes for salves and potions to combat the Bloodthorns' festering magic.

Lord Diel of Daggerfall and his sons are investigating the recent harpy attacks all along the coast. They hired a group of mercenaries called the Daggers to help them with their research, but the Daggers never returned from the Shrieking Scar.
The lunar priests at the Do'Krin Monastery have been attacked by the Stonefire cult. The survivors fear the cultists mean to steal a sacred relic: The Golden Claw.
I found the body of a Khajiiti woman on the terrace of Do'Krin Monastery. She was still clutching a letter and a small offering to the Bright Moons.
Battlereeve Alduril would like me to assist her in her assault on Tempest Island.
Ufgra is worried about a tribe of Goblins that has moved into Timberscar Hollow.

Three villages were absorbed into a plane of Oblivion, in an attempt to bring them into Coldharbour: one Dunmer, one Khajiit, and one Orc. The Dunmer <<1>> has a plan to help herself and the other village leaders escape.
Mezha-dro, a Khajiit servant of Meridia, asked for help sealing tears in Oblivion before more material from Tamriel falls through.
The Mane, on his way to the Handfasting in Silvenar, suddenly attacked his entourage and fled. Lord Gharesh-ri, the Speaker of the Mane, asked me to find him.
An undead army surges through Driladan Pass and assaults Marbruk on the command of the Shade of Prince Naemon.
Garnikh bet his axe that I can't best the Seamount hunters in duels.
An Orc named Magula has seen visions at three shrines around the island. I should visit these shrines and see the visions.
<<1>> is under siege, but the commander at the gate doesn't seem worried.
I've arrived at the city of Dune to find it under siege by Daedra and the forces of Javad Tharn.
While wading through the swamp, I stumbled into a cloud of roaming poison gas and passed out. Two Imperials rescued me and asked me to help them clean it up.
The Prophet and I are seeking a way to rescue Sai Sahan, the Redguard who hid away the Amulet of Kings.
<<1>> lost his lute in a riddle game with <<2>>.

The drunken cook, <<1>>, is in trouble. She bet her hunter friend that she'd collect ingredients from beasts all over Shadowfen and cook him a feast in Hissmir. Now sober, she is afraid to venture out into the fen, for fear of these same creatures.
<<1>> and his cohorts have taken up residence in Spindleclutch. <<1>> has returned to find his home overrun, and his son <<2>> missing.
In the depths of <<1>> I came across the corpse of <<2>>, cooked in his armor by a beast that dwells there.
In the depths of <<1>>, I found a <<2>> surrounded by bodies. One of them stirred when I took the urn.
Darien mentioned that a small group of Lion Guard soldiers went to search for Angof in the north. I should head in that direction and attempt to find them.
The hunt-wife of the Seamount clan thinks the chief's daughter is not mindful of her duties to the clan. She believes I could help sort things out.
<<1>>, a Khajiit investigating <<2>>, has asked for my assistance.
<<1>> is running low on supplies to help the many wounded in his care.
<<1>> needs special mushrooms found only in <<2>> to help the wounded.
Many of Bruma's citizens are lost or missing in the ruins.
I've found a scared bandit trying to hide in Portdun Watch. He wants me to take a token to his brother, though he was too frightened to tell me much more.
My actions have convinced Chief Tazgol to join the Daggerfall Covenant.
<<1>> needs his restoration scrolls charged.
<<1>> has received word that more Dremora are entering the city from the north.
<<1>> challenged me to learn more about the enemy so I can appreciate the dangers the folk of Bruma face.
I've found the body of a hunter in the wilds. Nearby was a notice he dropped detailing a bounty on senche-tiger fangs.
<<1>> asked me to leave supplies at a cache for messengers who're going for help.
The Wood Elves in this part of the Valenwood are opposed to the Dominion. I agreed to negotiate and attempt to convince them to swear allegiance to Queen Ayrenn.
After the death of Prince Naemon, Vicereeve Pelidil assumed leadership of the Veiled Heritance and stole the Staff of Magnus. Razum-dar has tracked him to somewhere in the area of Woodhearth.
I'm helping the Wooded Eye prevent Daedra from escaping Rootwater Grove into Greenshade.
An associate of Cariel's stopped me outside of Arenthia to ask for help. She's lost some critical supplies and letters, and wants my help in retrieving them.
<<1>> believes a Shadowed Path Magister is leading Bruma's intruders.
Evidence suggests that Vicereeve Pelidil and the Veiled Heritance are planning to attack the city of Woodhearth.
<<1>> asked me to search the manor for hidden Dremora portals.

I found a diary on a dead man in Icehammer's Vault. It described how the man and his family took refuge from a storm in Icehammer's Vault. They were eventually killed by the draugr that roam the burial chambers.
I found an exquisitely carved urn within Old Sord's Cave. It appears to belong to <<1>> of Windhelm.
I encountered a Nord in the Bastard's Tomb. He had been captured by the Stormfist Brigade on his way to his sister's wedding. He promised me a reward if I rescued him.
The Veiled Heritants plan to harm the Wilderking. If I enter Aranias' past through Maruin's story, I can change her future.
The vicecanons of Shadowfen tracked the Dominion's forces to the ancient Daedric ruin of <<1>>.

Thulvald's logging camp has been overrun by spriggans and trolls. He came to check on his workers and was chased off by the hostile creatures. Now he's worried about his workers and expects that his business is ruined.

Shifty Tom, one of Captain Blackheart's underlings, wants to give up the pirate's life. He plans to leave Blackheart Haven, the Captain's island fortress, but wants me to help him steal two magical relics from the Captain, first.
<<1>> was replaced by a Dominion skin-stealer. I need to find the imposter and stop the remaining skin-stealers in <<2>>.
<<1>> asked that I search for <<2>> and <<3>>.
To learn why the Wood Elves in this part of the Valenwood are opposed to the Dominion and to convince them to change their mind, I must negotiate with the Wilderking.
A Wood Elf named Benduin wants to show me how to build a guardian with special powers.

The Ancient Keepers, sworn to imprison the spirit of High Kinlord Rilis, have taken to forming Daedric pacts. Keeper Cirion has asked for help in defeating the corrupting force of Rilis, but will require fighting the Keepers directly.
A Khajiit named <<1>> has disappeared at the notorious Hadran's Caravan. The people who love him are losing hope of seeing him again. They have turned to me for help.
As I arrived at the town of Greenhill, a very drunk man ran up to me and began raving about evil strangers in town.
The Shade of Prince Naemon and the Veiled Heritance have somehow raised the infamous warriors of the Blackroot clan from the dead.
This tower is a lightless oubliette, a prison of darkness that binds King Laloriaran Dynar, the last Ayleid King.
I must find a way into the Castle of the Worm. There will be many dangers ahead, so I must make sure I am prepared.
Most of the Bosmer entering Verrant Morass are being corrupted by a blight that turns them into feral beasts. Indaenir believes the corruption comes from the Shade of Naemon.

I need to rebuild my army if we're going to have any chance of confronting Molag Bal and stopping the Planemeld. The mysterious Groundskeeper suggests I rescue as many people as I can and send them to the Hollow City.
Something strange is happening in Shademist Moors. The village of Longhaven needs someone who can uncover what might be behind it.
Destroying the cursed skull held by the Shademist vampires has cleared the moors of corruption, but Thorinor says his wife was among the missing and never returned.
The shoreline of <<1>> is lined with the shattered hulls of Aldmeri Dominion sailing vessels. Equipment and personnel are scattered along the beach.
The Maormer seek to prevent the Dominion from establishing themselves on <<1>>. They've launched a full-scale attack on <<2>>.
I met a man named Armin in the bottom of Divad's Chagrin mine. After seven years searching, he found his ancestors remains and wants to send word to his wife that he will soon return home.

I met Gadris the Dark Elf and Zur the Khajiit. These two mages share a single body, as their souls were melded at this Vile Laboratory when they arrived in Coldharbour. This soul-meld has weakened them. If they remain combined, they will surely die.
The Aldmeri Dominion seeks to secure the loyalty of <<1>>, but an old treaty with the Maormer prevents this.
A powerful mage named <<1>> went missing in the Temple of the Mourning Springs. I agreed to help his apprentice <<2>> search the temple for signs of her master.

I came across a magical recording of Vanus Galerion. The message says that the mage decided to enter the Black Forge on his own. He plans to reach the Great Shackle and destroy it, thus completing our mission in Coldharbour.
<<1>> of Applewatch asked me to deliver a list of supplies he needs for his inn.
I found a letter on the body of a bounty hunter. It mentions a woman named Wardiya in Bruma.
I found a note on the body of an Ebonheart Pact soldier. It mentions an egg brother named Bosekus in the town of Cropsford.
I found a note of debt in Coldrock Diggings.
I've agreed to deliver a sack of fertilizer for <<1>>.
I found a broken cart with a list of items that were supposed to be delivered to Lorene Menillet of Cropsford.
I need to halt the Daedric invasion from Moonhenge.
I've agreed to deliver a letter for a mysterious Imperial named <<1>>.
I found a bundle of damaged gifts meant for <<1>> who lives in <<2>>.
Rasha has asked me to deliver a small pouch of sand to an old friend.
I met a mage named <<1>> in Darkshade Caverns. She has asked for help investigating the Dwemer ruins beneath the mines.

Some of the mages who helped open the initial portal to Coldharbour were captured when they arrived. Now they're prisoners in the Daedric Court of Contempt, awaiting the verdict of Judge Xiven in the Hall of Judgment.
The Dominion took <<A:1>> to the Ayleid ruin of <<2>>. There they used its power to sever the Argonian connection with the Hist. As long as it remains in their possession, no Argonian eggs can hatch.
Thizzrini Arena is host to numerous arena games in a sprawling complex outside of Dune. To compete in the games, I must speak with the three Division Champions and earn the proper credentials.
I am competing in the Summoner Division of Thizzrini Arena. I need to work my way through the ranks in this division before I can challenge Tholbor, the Division Champion, in the main arena.
I am competing in the Sorcerer Division of Thizzrini Arena. I must fight through the ranks in order to fight Malarel, the Sorcerer Division Champion.
I am competing in the Swordmaster Division of Thizzrini Arena. I must rise through the ranks of contenders before I can battle Zara, the Swordmaster Division Champion.
I have defeated the champions of the three major divisions in Thizzrini Arena. Now I am ready to face Ishalga and become the Grand Champion of Thizzrini Arena.
The town of Arenthia has been occupied by a Colovian force. I've been tapped to help retake the city alongside a Khajiiti resistance force.
According to Centurion Gavo's confession, the Stonefire cult plans to summon a Dark Anchor within Arenthia.
I decided to ask Tzik'nith for help getting into the tower. Before she shows me the secret, however, she wants me to help her against the Wood Elves.
<<1>>, the slave dealer who runs <<2>>, sent his thugs to kill me and failed. His business partner, <<3>>, has grown tired of his slave-trading operation and wants me to eliminate him.
I've found a note from a Dwemer researcher's journal named Tharayya. She appears to have been searching for an ancient artifact referred to as the "Guardian's Eye."
Though Aranias was sent by the Veiled Heritance to kill him, the Wilderking believes she has actually come for another reason, and that our destinies are intertwined.
I found a notebook full of observations about the Ayleid wells around Cyrodiil. The book's owner may want it back.
Lady Laurent is displeased with her butler, Stibbons, for leading the Elves to Salas En. To get back in her good favor, he's asked me to help him by gathering Laurent's tools from among the ruins.
A suspicious woman asked me to relay a message to <<1>> in Bruma.
I found a set of robes in a bandit camp.
<<1>> is out in the wilds, looking for his son, Donus.
I found a note in a smuggler camp. A young Khajiit was captured and taken to <<1>> by the <<m:2>>.
Bowenas, the Treethane of Greenhill, is having trouble deciding what to do with Ezreba. The Khajiit helped the cultists to subvert the town, but she was forced to do so against her will.
I found a small silver flute in a crate. An inscription on the flute reads, "Halion of Chorrol." There might be a reward for the flute's return.
A spirit named <<1>> warned me of dark knowledge sealed in three forbidden tomes. She asked me to find all three and destroy them in a shrine on <<2>>.
I'm now participating in Lizard Racing, where I place bets on which lizard finishes the race first.
I'm now participating in Spikeball, a foot race where I can throw a Spikeball to stun opponents.
I'm now betting on the Troll Arena, where I place bets on which Troll wins the fight.
<<1>> at the <<2>> asked me to deliver a letter to his cousin Asvorn in <<3>>.
The chief of the Ash'abah and many of the tribe's warriors have been poisoned, most likely by the Withered Hand. I agreed to help Talia at-Marimah gather ingredients for an antidote.
There's a crisis at <<1>>. Something is wrong with their Great Tree, and the locals believe it has something to do with the tree's roots, which can be accessed from a cave below it.
Someone named Jena is being threatened. She apparently lives in Cheydinhal.
Bandits attacked a chapel just over the border from Reaper's March. A group of temple guards and their priestess tracked them to the ruins of Fort Sphinxmoth.
I met <<1>> fishing in the cold waters of northern Cyrodiil. She asked if I could bring some of her catch to her friend <<2>> in <<3>>.

I decided to ask Faraniel for help getting into the tower. Before she shows me the secret, however, she wants me to help her convince the Wood Elves to leave the forest and stop working for Molag Bal.
An Aldmeri Dominion fleet was shipwrecked here by a hurricane. I wasn't part of the wreck, but perhaps I can use the chaos as cover.
Sea Elves have entered Serpent's Grotto, and one of the Maormer mages has broken the seals that bound a massive sea serpent here for centuries.
I have a doctor's bag belonging to <<1>>, who may be in <<2>>.
<<1>> needs herbs delivered to <<2>> in Bruma.
Apphia Matia asked me to let Brielus Colus of Cheydinhal know that she is bearing his child.
On his deathbed, the chief of the Ash'abah says he has foreseen that I must join the tribe and defeat the Withered Hand. I must participate in an initiation ritual to become an Ash'abah.
The Eye of the Queen, Cariel, wants my help to uncover corruption in the little town of Pa'alat. She suspects a former Eye of the Queen has gone rogue.
I have been sent to the Moonlit Clearing to meet with a member of the lunar clergy. I'm supposed to find out if I am the Moon Hallowed.
The Shade of Prince Naemon has seized control of Hectahame where he is corrupting the Heart of the Valenwood. I must assist Queen Ayrenn and Indaenir in defeating him.
I found a letter from someone named Iocundus in <<1>>.
Awash in a sea of rats, Laughing Moons Plantation is in dire need of assistance. <<1>> asked me to help deal with the infestation.
A moon-sugar plantation suffered a terrible fire. The family in charge of the plantation needs a hand to recover from their tragedy.
The dead have risen at Tu'whacca's Throne. Throne Keeper Farvard insists we consult the king before taking any action. I have agreed to take word back to the palace in Sentinel.
<<1>> asked me to travel to <<2>> and look for her sister, <<3>>.
<<1>> has asked that I travel to <<2>> and inform his brother <<3>> that his wife is dead.
Clan Mother Kazirra told me to travel to the city of Rawl'kha, to bring word of the Mane's change of heart.
A merchant in the Shrouded Vale reports seeing a village that has mysteriously and suddenly appeared in a nearby cave.

The army has been gathered and the time has come to take the battle to Molag Bal! But to reach the planar vortex at the heart of the Dark Lord's inner sanctum, we have to cross the well-defended Chasm.
I've entered Cyrodiil, eager to help the Dominion win the war.
I've reached the siege range. Zan advised me to try each weapon. I should also talk to Firamo and Miniel to learn more about the weapons.
Taralin says there is much more for me to learn about the war in Cyrodiil.
I found a note meant for <<1>>, who apparently lives in <<2>>. He might appreciate getting it.
Lunar Priestess Kauzanabi-jo has indicated I should make for the temple of Moonmont. The Champions, the new candidates for the Mane, will join me there.
The priestess Kauzanabi-jo told me my next goal should be to help the people of Arenthia. Apparently Mane Akkhuz-ri is somewhere amid the Colovian invaders of the city.
I traveled to the city of Rawl'kha, where I'm to help the Lunar Champions begin their spiritual journey.
<<1>> in <<2>> is wanted by a pack of werewolves.
Vampires occupy the Orchard beyond the Chasm, somehow empowered by Molag Bal's Harvest Heart. The vampires need to be dealt with before our forces can push forward toward the planar vortex.
<<1>> asked me to deliver a message to his brother <<2>> in <<3>>.
Within Fort Sphinxmoth I encountered one of the chapel guards. She believes more of her companions were still alive elsewhere in the complex.
I saved Dune from the plots of Javad Tharn. Now I must aid the Lunar Champion as she walks the Two Moons Path, a mystical Khajiit ritual used to anoint a new Mane.
I have completed the first part of the Two Moons Path with the Lunar Champion. Now we must venture into the Den of Lorkhaj and complete the mystical journey.
Honorless criminals are left in the Tears of the Dishonored. Darius begged me to find the remains of his wife, Zariya, and consecrate them as he believes she was innocent.
I've arrived in Cyrodiil, ready to help the Pact win the war.
I've reached the siege range. Adalmor advised me to try each weapon. I should also talk to Looks-Forward and Lirtis to learn more about the weapons.
Galsi Mavani says I have more to learn about the conflict in Cyrodiil.
I entered Cyrodiil, ready to help the Covenant win the war.
I've reached the siege range. Bugbesh told me to try each weapon. I should also talk to Marc and Jaleel to learn more about the weapons.
Aurorelle Varin says there is much more for me to learn about the war in Cyrodiil.
I restored Vanus Galerion and disrupted activities at the Black Forge. Now we need to assault the Great Shackle and end the threat of the Planemeld once and for all.

I've been asked by a moon priestess named Felari to help with a project that could help firm up relations between the Khajiit and Wood Elves. They are working to return home relics and bones from ancient battle sites.
The Mages Guild has launched an expedition into Selene's Web to seek out and study an ancient forest spirit rumored to live here.

Queen Ayrenn must deal with the aftermath of her brother's betrayal and settle matters in Grahtwood. In the meantime, she asked me to travel to Marbruk, in Greenshade, and secure the Staff of Magnus from its vault.
I found the journal of Graccus, an Imperial who destroyed a Bosmer village to find a treasure buried below.
I discovered a Spinner named Melrethel imprisoned in the cellars of the Vile Manse. She claims to be from the Wood Elf village that Graccus razed and built his manor upon.
Vicereeve Pelidil and his Maormer allies have attacked and seized control of Seaside Sanctuary.
The Wood Elf brewing town of Willowgrove is trying to expand their beehives. They've hired help to clear the forest. This help appears to have suffered some difficulties.
I found Minstrel Idria's lute abandoned in the Grotto of Depravity.
Pelidil's plans to lead the Maormer in attack against Valenwood have been exposed and Treethane Fariel suggests I go to Seaside Sanctuary to try to repel the Maormer invasion.
I found a pendant with the names <<1>> and <<2>> engraved upon it while exploring the Cave of Trophies.
I met a Dark Elf named Dralnas who claims that Dremora have taken his soul to feed to something he calls the Anguish Gem.
I found a hastily written note from Lady Laurent's servant, Stibbons. He was captured by Daedra after we arrived in Coldharbour and is being held in a nearby tower.
The mine called Kuna's Delve has been assaulted by a pack of bloodthirsty trolls.
Aranias and Andur were sent by the Veiled Heritance to kill the Wilderking. They are now forcing their way through Greenheart towards the Wilderking's throne.
A Breton shipbuilder named Jeromec Lemal has asked me to help him recover the warship designs from three ships under construction in the docks at Tava's Blessing.
I've arrived at Leki's Blade, a school of swordsmanship in the sands of Alik'r.
I met a Soul Shriven named Fatahala. She claims that this Manor of Revelry isn't what it appears to be. Furthermore, she wants me to help Stibbons, who she tells me is in mortal danger here.

The final assault to end the Planemeld is at hand. We need to fight our way through Molag Bal's defenses and reach the portal to the planar vortex. Only then can we end this threat and save our world.
The priestess Kauzanabi-jo told me my next goal should be to make for the temple in Rawl'kha. I need to aid the Lunar Champions in their journey.
The bandits at Sep's Spine have canceled hostilities for sake of the boss's daughter's wedding.
A courier came to me with an urgent request to go help Prince Azah fight in the small town of Tava's Blessing and to send the Scholar's apprentice, Shiri, back to Bergama.
Abnur Tharn seeks an audience with me away from the Harborage. I should see what he wants.
Seaside Sanctuary is back in the control of the Aldmeri Dominion, but Vicereeve Pelidil has escaped aboard a Maormer vessel.
<<1>> is a town in Bangkorai fabled to have the power to cure any disease. <<2>> and his husband Draven seek whatever cure the village offers, though they don't know what the cost may be.
I've been invited to join a group of adventurers called the Undaunted.
Dominion soldiers erected barricades around a tribe of Argonian refugees living in <<c:1>>. <<2>> needs help resolving the Argonians' situation.
I found an odd, glowing handaxe in a pack at the bottom of Gurzag's Mine. A note of sale indicated a Bosmer named Forthor sold it to the Orcs. He's part of the Marbruk Mages Guild.

Thonoras and his wife, Pariel, were captured and tortured by Wood Orcs. Pariel begged Hircine to save them, and Hircine "changed her." After helping her husband escape, Pariel disappeared into a cave beneath the Falinesti Spring Site.
I found a talking skull named <<1>> near <<Ac:2>>. He wants me to piece him together so he can help thwart Worm Cultists in the area.
King Dynar has devised a two-pronged attack to take control of the Reaver Citadel. It utilizes the old Fighters and Mages Guilds' halls located in this ancient Nirn city.
I ran into a very hung-over mage in Rawl'kha. He had too much to drink, lost several magical relics, and now fears he'll never gain an apprenticeship to Telenger the Artificer.
Tappo's journal details his victims. He kept a keepsake from each.
Whisper Grove has been turned to a City of Ash by the forces of Mehrunes Dagon. If I don't intervene, the remaining Bosmer will be slaughtered.
It appears a hunting band was overcome by a powerful wispmother, as their frozen forms are scattered about the mire.

Vanus Galerion of the Mages Guild has a plan to stop Molag Bal's incursion of Tamriel. It requires convincing the three alliances to join forces with the Mages Guild and Fighters Guild to assault Coldharbour.

I convinced the leaders of the three alliances to meet to discuss a plan to attack Molag Bal's realm of Coldharbour. The meeting takes place on the historic island of Stirk. Hopefully, the meeting will go smoothly.
Sorderion has charged me with apprehending Aldolin, a traitor to the Dominion who has been giving aid to the Ebonheart Pact.
<<1>>, an innkeeper in <<2>>, informed me of bandits who kidnapped his daughter <<3>>. He asked me to bring her home safely.

A small group of Wood Elves entered the Falinesti Spring Site, which has been taken over by Wood Orcs. When they petitioned the Wood Orcs to leave, they were taken prisoner. Egannor managed to escape, but his friends are still in the camp.
The Vinedusks are spread thin and need my assistance.
A stone being named Sumiril carries a book that contains a story about how he came to be.
I met a Khajiit called Cold-Eyes who is looking to collect a debt. He'll give me a cut if I help him.
A Khajiit trader was tricked by an Altmer merchant captain who gave her low quality fabric in place of the rare silks she traded for.
A Bosmer scout claims her band was ambushed by Argonian invaders. She managed to get away in the scuffle, but her allies are now captives of the Argonians.
A shady character told me I was needed at the city of Arenthia. This Orthoron said someone of my prowess would come in handy.
A strange priest at an old Khajiiti ruin told me that my path is laid out before him. He suggests I go to the city of Rawl'kha to learn more.
A mysterious Khajiit named Hunal spoke to me outside of the city of Dune. He told me some important task awaits me at the temple known as Moonmont.
I found a journal that belonged to a monk of the Lunar faith named Yenadar. The journal mentions that he has a sister named Kala in S'ren-ja. I should return the journal to her.
I agreed to gather Red Mountain Ash for <<1>>, so she can make Nirnroot wine.
I agreed to gather Red Mountain Ash for <<1>>, so he can make Nirnroot wine.
I agreed to gather Red Mountain Ash for <<1>>, so he can make Nirnroot wine.
I was lead to an old instrument in the ruins of Thibaut's Cairn by a spectral woman. The recoder was engraved with "Valencia Nasica, the Exalted Bard of Dune."
Master Pellingare, a Wayrest nobleman, has gone missing. His guards, Yahyif and Gedric, have come to the sewers looking for him after he was last seen heading into the undercity tunnels.
I discovered the body of one of the Fighters Guild soldiers in Mal Sorra's Tomb. She started writing a note to her cousin, Grundskar, another soldier.
Nature itself has turned against the Bosmer village of Karthdar and its citizens are desperate to restore peace.
A villager from Tava's Blessing asked that I seek out a Thronekeeper named Luala al-Tava.
Scout Yanul says Prince Azah has his soldiers searching the desert for the Withered Hand.
After defeating the Maormer assault on Khenarthi's Roost, Razum-dar has asked me to report to <<1>> in the Auridon city of Vulkhel Guard.
I've been given a letter to deliver to Queen Ayrenn to bring her up to speed on the events that have occurred and inform her of our victory over Vicereeve Pelidil.
Gasteau Chamrond knows how to escape the structure I've fallen into. He'll help me get out if I lend him my strength.
A Bosmer named Adamir, and his associate Timiwe, are attempting to animate an assemblage of rodent parts.
Ledronor, a member of a hunting order called the Hounds, asked for my help in hunting a troll.
Radreth, a new member of the hunting company the Hounds, asked for my help in hunting a giant wasp.
The Prophet contacted me through a magical projection. He asked me to seek out a place called the Harborage, where he has taken refuge. I should go to him and ensure that he is safe.
I've been summoned back to the Harborage in preparation for our battle against Molag Bal.
I've discovered an order of hunters called Brackenleaf's Briars. They protect a tree they say was planted by Y'ffre at the creation of the world.

While exploring the Tribulation Crypt, I encountered a ghost that beckoned me deeper into the tomb. The ghost led me to an ancient sword engraved with the following message: "Marcelle Stenric of Shornhelm."
Varen Aquilarios and Abnur Tharn have found the location of Sai Sahan within the Halls of Torment. I need to venture into these halls and save the final, missing companion.
Varen Aquilarios asked me to accompany Sai Sahan on a trip back to his ancestral home. An old friend, Kasura, may have knowledge of how to sneak into Sancre Tor.

While exploring Hildune's Secret Refuge, I found a journal written by Nadafa. It tells the story of how she was seduced by a vampire. The journal mentions that her husband, Giran, works in Northpoint at the cemetery and lives in the fishing village.

I met a Mages Guild novice named Anenya just inside the Erokii Ruins. She was sent here on an assignment to recover a relic called the Tear of Anurraame, but she can't carry it out. I agreed to recover the relic and bring it back to Shornhelm.
The Rain Catcher Fields, a sandy expanse of johads gathering water in large pools, has recently been overrun by beetles from the desert.
Explorers from the Mages Guild awoke an ancient threat at <<Ac:1>>. Undead creatures have slain or captured many within their expedition.
Undead soldiers have been haunting Traitor's Tor ever since the end of Ranser's War, but no one's ever been able to find out why.
I found a strange sapling that spoke to me, confused about its own ability to think and feel. It has vague memories of walking and a nearby cave. I agreed to help the sapling get some answers.
I have found the notes of a mage named Mercano from Woodhearth in the depths of an Ayleid ruin where the Veiled Heritants were raising undead.
The time has come to confront Molag Bal and reclaim my soul.

I discovered the remains of a mage outside a cave in Shademist Moors. While there are no shortage of victims around here, the presence of the Mages Guild urges me to investigate what might have happened to the rest of them.
I found a dead adventurer in Barrow Trench. They entered the mine to collect rare ingredients for an alchemist in Woodhearth.
The Shade of Prince Naemon is spreading corruption across Greenshade. I must help Indaenir cleanse the corruption.

The Torog's Spite Bandits are dedicated to profit and vengeance from targeting families descended from those who sacked Orsinium. An Orc historian named Maaga wants to record the bandits' deeds but needs to know which Orc clan deserves credit.
Before losing Aranias' memories, the Wilderqueen told me that she knew about the Veiled Heritance plot to steal the Staff of Magnus. She suggested I go to the city of Woodhearth.
<<1>>, a priestess of Azura, has long suffered at the hands of Molag Bal. Her pain is so great it has torn a hole between <<2>> and <<3>>, an Ayleid ruin in <<4>>.
Verandis completed his research and discovered that his missing memories lead to an ancient ruin in the Lorkrata Hills. He needs my help to discover the secret hidden within the ruins.

The hamlet of Moira's Hope has met with disaster. Bloodfiends fill the streets, and the few survivors that remain are trying desperately to stay alive. I agreed to help Adusa-daro provide aid and find out who is behind this attack.
I met a Bosmer Adventurer named Gluineth locked in a cell in Troll's Toothpick. I've agreed to spring her from the cell and escort her out of the cave.

I found a Knight of St. Pelin in the Crypt of the Exiles who died while on an important quest. She sought to recover a sacred Redguard artifact, the Memory Stone of Makela Leki, and return it to a Redguard scholar.
Sai Sahan has recovered from his experiences in the Halls of Torment and is ready to guide me to the Amulet of Kings. He hid the artifact in Sancre Tor, an ancient Imperial catacomb.
<<1>>'s citizens are killing one another in the streets. Dominion soldiers cordoned off the town, but are in dire need of assistance.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract from Sebazi in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract from Arkas at the Southern Morrowind gate.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted the Fighters Guild contract Arkas offered.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract from Arkas at the Southern Morrowind gate.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract from Ikran at the Northern High Rock gate in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract in Cyrodiil.
I accepted a Fighters Guild contract from Ikran at the Northern High Rock gate.
The princess of Evermore is being cared for in the Viridian Woods, but her future is uncertain.
<<1>>'s husband, a minstrel named Sorion, went missing after going on tour through <<2>>. I agreed to help track him down.
We've taken control of the Shrouded Pass and the way to the Doomcrag is open. The time has come to make our final assault and reach Montclair and  the cursed relic known as the Lightless Remnant.
The <<1>>, one of the legendary resting places of the Walking City of Falinesti, is buzzing with activity. It seems <<2>> has begun an excavation.
A novice from the Mages Guild named Gahgdar was duped by a witch into giving her a valuable book from the guildhall in Hallin's Stand. He asked me to help him get the book back.
Lady Clarisse Laurent is on the trail of the Emerald Chalice, a relic stolen from the Mages Guild by the exiled Nord mage, Malofar. She tracked him here to Breagha-Fin.
The Reachmen threat has been averted, but Evermore is still in danger, and Queen Arzhela needs my help.
On approaching <<1>>, I came upon <<2>>, a Khajiit in trouble with the local authorities.
The Llodos plague is ravaging the Deshaan countryside. I met someone from a town known as the Serk. He's on his way to warn people about the plague.
I found a strange glowing amulet on a corpse in the woods.
<<1>> has heard rumblings of discontent in <<2>>, the Aldmeri Dominion's capital. She wants me to travel ahead of her and assess the situation.
Onsi's Breath was captured by Imperial soldiers who hold its inhabitants captive.
Reachmen attacked Northglen. They must be stopped before they can attack the city of Evermore.
Imperials have been raiding Martyr's Crossing, and the Knights of Saint Pelin have wound up having to depend on the help of Baandari merchants for assistance.
A bloody conflict has erupted between the noble houses of Rivenspire and High King Emeric has asked me to go there on his authority and attempt to restore order.

Shornhelm, the largest city in Rivenspire, is a city divided. House Montclair has annexed part of the city. Darien Gautier suggested I go to Shornhelm and help Countess Tamrith and Baron Dorell deal with the situation.

I need to locate Verandis Ravenwatch and find out if he can tell me more about Baron Montclair and where he might be hiding. He may also know more about what set Montclair on this path of destruction.
<<1>> needs couriers to make deliveries around <<2>>.
Scholar <<1>> and his guide, <<2>> became separated in the Sunken Road.

Imperial forces have taken control of Bangkorai Garrison, the strategic keep that divides northern and southern Bangkorai. King Emeric and the Lion Guard have come to aid Queen Arzhela and the Knights of Saint Pelin in reconquering the garrison.
The ruins of the ancient Wood Elf village of Gil-Var-Delle is under the corrupting influence of Molag Bal. The Worm Cult is active here, and my help is needed to put an end to their schemes.
A group of vampire hunters has come to this area to cleanse it of its infestation, including a powerful vampire lord. They've asked for my assistance.
<<1>> is distraught. Her adorable pet, Puddles, ran away, and she's afraid that the little creature is lost.
The Vinedusk Rangers want me to help quash the remnants of the Blacksap Rebellion, the Wood Elf civil war that ended with the Dominion's formation.
Hallin's Stand is ready to take back their town from the Imperial's Seventh Legion.
I met <<1>> and <<2>> at their camp along the roadside. They're fleeing for their lives from their ransacked farmstead.

If <<1>> is to prove herself worthy of leading the Aldmeri Dominion to glory, she must complete the ratification ceremony in <<c:2>> of <<3>>. Legends say it can reveal those worthy of becoming emperor … or empress.
Knights of Arkay search for holy relics to help combat the rising undead threat spreading throughout Rivenspire. So far, the knights have yet to return.

I met a somewhat drunk and totally bootless Breton named Parquier Gimbert outside of Northpoint. He said he lost a valuable mace while hunting for mudcrabs along the shore. He thinks that maybe a Hagraven was involved. Also, he has no shoes.

In ruined Klathzgar, I found a note from an Altmeri scholar investigating an ancient mystery. An Ayleid princess named Urenenya vanished centuries ago, and the scholar came here after learning of her connection to the Dwemer architect Klazthgar.
Adusa has further need of my help. She's learned of another plot, an assassin contracted by allies of House Montclair.
Adusa has discovered that the Montclairs have assembled a list of targets they have marked for elimination.
I returned to find Adusa and Castle Ravenwatch under attack. The list of targets puts Adusa right at the top.

Using the codebook I discovered, Adusa has determined that Montclair's nephew, Rohlbert, is behind the assassination plot. She believes that if we eliminate Rohlbert, we can end this part of the Montclair threat once and for all.
Teeba-Ja was a member of the Bitterhand Bandits, but when they became more violent, she decided to leave. She wants to start a new life in Shornhelm.

Constable Agazu says the mayor of Fell's Run fired her for no reason and appointed a new constable. She says all the townspeople are acting strange as well, but no one's talking. She wants me to help find out what's going on.
<<1>> has asked me to find her husband Ignobert, who went missing after a vampire attack.
Now that the threat to Rivenspire has been dealt with, there's still the matter of crowning a true ruler for the region.
Countess Tamrith has sent a priest to sanctify her dead soldiers at Camp Tamrith. Those particularly devoted to the Light of Arkay have a profound fear of turning into undead creatures.
Fallen Grotto is under the control of <<1>> and his Reachmen.
<<1>> has lost track of her husband and her dog. I've offered to help her look for both of them.
I met a man named Beryn in the woods, recovering from an epic drinking bout at his camp. He's worried because he fears his friend <<1>> has wandered into a nearby spider cave on a dare.
All is not well in <<1>>. The Khajiit lack an embassy, which is the cause of tensions in the capital city of the Aldmeri Dominion.

I discovered a research journal kept by an Orc named Grularz in Crestshade Mine. She was apparently studying the trolls until they decided to kill her. The journal referred to a brother named Gothurg in Shornhelm.
Adusa fears that Montclair agents still operate out of Shornhelm. She wants me to follow a courier in hopes the courier will lead me to the Montclair informer.
<<1>> is concerned for her friend <<2>>. He recently entered a cave full of deadly spiders and hasn't been seen since.

Queen Maraya has asked a personal favor. She's heard disturbing rumors about some of her father's enemies returning, so she's asked me to go to Sentinel in the Alik'r Desert and ensure that both the kingdom and her father are safe.
<<1>> must complete the ratification ceremony if her allies are to accept her as leader of the Aldmeri Dominion. At the heart of the ceremony is <<c:2>>, an ancient Ayleid artifact.
Jowan and Mayla want to give their family a proper burial. They asked me to accompany them.
I was approached shortly after saving <<1>> from the Jackdaw attack. <<2>> approached me and revealed she works for the Wood Elf king. She said he needs the aid of impressive people such as myself.
I met an old scholar near the Ayleid ruins who came to power a crystal for his research, but found the ruins swarming with Worm Cultists.
I found a journal that belonged to a thief called Nedras the Sly. He apparently turned to crime in order to support his ailing sister in Northpoint.
I found a journal on the body of Klaandor Axe-Bearer. It details his transformation into a vampire. Seems like he was looking for someone to kill him.
